properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Coolaroo, Dallas, Jacana, Meadow Heights, Attwood, Broadmeadows, Gladstone Park, Greenvale, Westmeadows
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Attwood, Broadmeadows, Coolaroo, Dallas, Gladstone Park, Greenvale, Jacana, Meadow Heights, Westmeadows.

  • There is a grassfire at Barry Rd, Meadow Heights that is not yet under control.
  • This grassfire is creating a lot of smoke travelling from barry Rd Soccer Oval in all directions with the wind.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • As much as possible stay out of the smoke.
  • Avoid driving in the smoke.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • The following road is closed: Barry Road west of Pascoe Vale Road.
This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 03/01/2025 06:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

- This grassfire is creating a lot of smoke travelling from barry Rd Soccer Oval in all directions with the wind.


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Huon Creek, West Wodonga.

  • There is a grassfire at Felltimber Creek Rd, West Wodonga that is now under control.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 2pm. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Review your fire survival plan.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are expected to remain in the area for several hours. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • There are no road closures in the area. 
  • This will be the final message for this fire, unless conditions change. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 03/01/2025 09:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: the area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for the area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins.

This Advice replaces the Advice message issued on December 31, 2024, at 7.19pm   

Burning out operations have been undertaken to help strengthen the containment lines around the fire. An increase in smoke may be visible in nearby communities.   

The spread of the bushfire has slowed, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
 
The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
Community newsletter
Grampians National Park and surrounds - newsletter number 3

What you should do: 

  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings.  
  • If returning to fire affected areas, proceed with caution.  
  • Road closures are still in place. Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
  • Review your fire survival plan.  
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.  
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 356 682. Download the Wildlife Emergency App.

Recovery and Resilience 

If you have been or may be impacted by the current bushfires, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. 

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 
 
  • Residents accessing fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed. Crews will assess and treat over the coming days. 
  • Be mindful of the increased traffic. Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area.
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 03/01/2025 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:

The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Thursday 02 January 2025, 07:30 am Next Update: Friday 03 January 2025, 07:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35589/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for the area surrounding Lake Wartook, including Lake Lonsdale, Wartook and Zumsteins. This Advice replaces the Advice message issued on December 31, 2024, at 7.19pm Burning out operations have been undertaken to help strengthen the containment lines around the fire. An increase in smoke may be visible in nearby communities. The spread of the bushfire has slowed, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. The Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria website. No access to the park is permitted. There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania.
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for the eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania. 

This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act message issued on December 30, 2024, at 3.10pm.  

Only residents are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. 

If returning to the fire affected area, proceed with caution.

The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria Website. No access to the park is permitted.
The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
Community newsletter
Grampians National Park and surrounds - newsletter number 3

What you should do: 
 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Road closures are still in place. Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 356 882 or download the Wildlife Emergency App.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 

  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Leave early. Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area. 

Recovery and Resilience 

If you have been or may be impacted by the current bushfires in Victoria, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.   

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan. 

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.
Impacts in your area: 

  • Residents accessing fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed. Crews will assess and treat over the coming days. 
  • Be mindful of the increased traffic. Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area.
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website. 
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.   

The next update is expected by 03/01/2025 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.  

Accessibility: 

  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Threat is Reduced - Monitor Conditions Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Thursday 02 January 2025, 07:30 am Next Update: Friday 03 January 2025, 07:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35592/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for the eastern side of the Grampians National Park from Halls Gap to Bornes Hill, including Mafeking and Watgania. This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act message issued on December 30, 2024, at 3.10pm. Only residents are allowed to return to their properties via Traffic Management Points, proof of address will be required. If returning to the fire affected area, proceed with caution. The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria Website. No access to the park is permitted. The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Sandy Point, Yanakie.

  • There is a bushfire at Yanakie that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Millar Road and Hourigan Camp Lane in a westerly direction towards Shallow Inlet. 
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are on scene and have slowed the spread of fire in paddocks and coastal land adjacent to Shallow Inlet.
  • Aircraft are operating in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 03/01/2025 07:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Dumosa .

  • There is a haystack fire at Corner Swan Hill - Donald & Calder Hwy, Dumosa. 
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities.
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire and will continue to monitor this fire. 
  • This fire may continue to burn for up to 3-4 days.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: area from Pomonal and Moyston, including Lake Fyans and Willaura.
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire for the area from Pomonal and Moyston, including Lake Fyans and Willaura. 

This Advice replaces the Advice message issued on December 31, 2024, at 7.19pm.

Burning out operations near Halls Gap will be undertaken over the coming days to help strengthen the fire containment lines. An increase in smoke may be visible in Halls Gap and nearby communities.

The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 

Halls Gap and the Grampians National Park remains closed to visitors. For further details visit the Parks Victoria Website. No access to the park is permitted.
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Community newsletter
Grampians National Park and surrounds - newsletter number 3

What you should do:

  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings.
  • If returning to fire affected areas, proceed with caution.
  • Road closures are still in place. Check the VicTraffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
  • Review your fire survival plan.
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 356 682. Download the Wildlife Emergency App.

Recovery and Resilience

If you have been or may be impacted by the current bushfires, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now.

Over the holiday season, try to focus on what is within your control, such as staying up to date with the latest warnings and alerts at www.emergency.vic.gov.au (or the VicEmergency App on your mobile phone), and reviewing your personal emergency plan.

For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief.

Impacts in your area:

  • Residents accessing fire affected areas must remain vigilant, as tree hazards may be present. Many roads within the fire affected areas have not been assessed and remain closed. Crews will assess and treat over the coming days. 
  • Be mindful of the increased traffic. Firefighting vehicles and heavy equipment are still working in the area.
  • Smoke from bushfires can reduce air quality and may affect your health. For more information visit the Better Health website.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 

The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley and surrounds.

This Advice replaces the Advice message issued on December 31, 2024, at 4.22pm.  

Burning out operations have been undertaken to help strengthen the containment lines around the fire. An increase in smoke may be visible in nearby communities.

There is currently no threat to this warning area, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mountain Bay, Bonnie Doon, Mansfield, Piries
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for the Delatite Arm Reserve campsite, Bonnie Doon, Brack Bridge, Goughs Bay, Howes Creek, Lake Eildon, Mansfield, Mountain Bay, Piries. 

  • There is a bushfire at the Delatite Arm Reserve campsite that is under control at Highett Ridge Track.
  • Firefighters are currently responding to this fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Some tracks in the area will be closed to traffic while emergency services respond.
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice issued at 5:13 pm on Thursday 2 January.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 06/01/2025 09:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
